SALESFORCE HELP
DOCS
ENHANCE YOUR CUSTOMER EXPERIENCE WITH SALESFORCE FEEDBACK MANAGEMENT
Create Survey Data Maps for Sentiment Insights

Create a data map to use to analyze the sentiment of survey responses.

REQUIRED EDITIONS AND USER PERMISSIONS
Available in: Lightning Experience
Available in: Enterprise, Unlimited, and Developer Editions
Available with the Feedback Management - Starter and Feedback Management - Growth licenses, and the Sentiment Insights license


USER PERMISSIONS NEEDED
To create or update data maps:	
Create and send survey permissions
Read and Create permission for the objects whose records the data map creates or updates
Read and Create permission for fields that the data map creates or updates
Read permission for records with mapped ID

To view data maps:	Read permission for the Survey object
Open the survey whose responses you want to analyze for sentiment insights.
In the Survey Builder, click Advanced Settings, and then select Survey Data Mapping.
Click New Mapping.
Name the mapping.
Select how you want to process responses.
To process survey responses in real time, select Create record.
To process survey responses in bulk at a later time, select Update record.
For Target Object, select AI Sentiment Result.
Select the Condition Type.
To always create records from responses, select Every time.
To define rules that determine when to create records, select Based on conditions, and then define the conditions.
Specify values for the predefined AI Sentiment Result fields.
For Name, enter a name for the AI Sentiment Result record.
For Service Type, select Amazon Comprehend DetectSentiment.
For Source Text Field, select Response Value .
NOTE The value in the Source Text Field is analyzed for its sentiment. Selecting Response Value ensures that participants’ responses to text questions are analyzed.
For Source Text Language, select the language in which participants respond to the survey.
If all the participants can respond to the survey in a single language, select that language as the value.
If participants can respond to the survey in multiple languages, select the language of the related survey responses. To do so, for Information Type, select Response Fields, and for Value, select Language.
Specify the field and value for the AI Sentiment Result object’s Source Object ID.
Click Add Row.
For Target Object Field, select Source Object ID.
Select the text question whose responses you want to analyze.
Specify the field and value for the AI Sentiment Result’s Status.
Click Add Row.
For Target Object Field, select Status.
To process survey responses in real time, select Submitted as the target object field’s value. To process survey responses in bulk at a later time, select Draft.
Save the mapping and the survey.

Use the Flow action or a template to process survey responses.

SEE ALSO
Create Survey Data Maps to Create or Update Records
